Of course it goes without saying I didn't ever say it #petty
I never once said his name in front of him as I didn't want him to criticise my French, culminated in him genuinely shouting "SAY MY NAME!"
He replied witheringly: "Fiona I don't have time to read about what's going on in IRELAND!" I was like "Oh right... I am... from Ireland?"
He's the one I asked for some insight when the IMF came to Ireland etc in 2010/2011 and shit was hitting the fan with bond-holders.
He made the fatal error of tagging a photo with his bougie apartment complex name. Looked it up there. One bed rent a month? £2,200. Lol.
I follow my French ex from years ago on Instagram. He now works in high-powered finance in London.
results: inconclusive https://t.co/CXy9C5TmmO

"In my day, the graffiti was a lot more sectarian!"
"Shut up Auntie Fiona, and I know you've been stealing my pocket money for wine."
Bobby Sands graffiti was a big thing on school desks in my day. Never see it around any more. Further evidence we're turning West Brit.

"Draw me like one of your French girls..."
*spray paints massive dick on wall, scribbles RIP BOBBY SANDS on school desk*
i think she'll be fine pal https://t.co/Be7OkimAXB
If you think the heinous crimes of Kermit Gosnell give support to a pro-life stance, then you're going to hate this Harold Shipman story...
BREDA O'BRIEN IN HER STANDING NATIONAL NEWSPAPER COLUMN: Abortion never gets written about by mainstream media!
BREDA O'BRIEN AT YOUR DINNER PARTY: While this lamb shank is delicious, you're completely ignoring the abortion issue. Pass the mint. Thanks

Similar to how an ex once said to me "You'd never speak to @mmegannnolan like this!" I forgot myself and replied "Yeah, well I LIKE Megan!"
Several friends have complained, in the way one might do about a faulty product, about how polite I initially seemed when they first met me
They're not really nameless!!! I was being poetic - if they were nameless, the post system would be absolute chaos. Imagine!
When the train pulls into an unending and grim streak of nameless, nondescript apartment blocks and you think... ah back in Dublin at last
AND SOMETIMES ALL THREE!
I just had my fourth coffee of the day (usually I'm a two max person) and I'm vacillating between feeling great, violently ill and insane

2 - the big spoon too big for the pot. Frankly this simply not true unless you're eating a Petit Filous in which case please call it quits.
1 - it'd be gone too quick otherwise. How long do you want to be sitting there eating a yoghurt? An hour? Get with the programme.
Would also like to address two common justifications for tea spoon usage.
Been accused of "looking simple", being "a raving lunatic" and a "sicko" for my brave and noble stance on eating yogurts with a big spoon
